metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9323 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The xdr_status_vector function in Firebird before 2.1.7 and 2.5.x before 2.5.3 SU1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference, segmentation fault, and crash) via an op_response action with a non-empty status.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firebird2.5-classic - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
firebird2.5-classic-common - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
firebird2.5-common - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
firebird2.5-examples - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
firebird2.5-server-common - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
firebird2.5-super - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
firebird2.5-superclassic - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
libfbclient2 - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
libfbembed2.5 - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
libib-util - 2.5.3.26778.ds4-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firebird2.5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.3.26778.ds4-5').
